alert.note: Alert for Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:53PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Apache County near Ganado through 430 PM MDT... At 351 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site, or 30 miles south of Chinle, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized flooding is possible. Locations impacted include... Cornfields Chapter House, Burnside, Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site, Kinlichee Chapter House and Ganado. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 441 and 453. Highway 191 between mile markers 401 and 418. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
